page.title: 05Horse riding and the Forge
page.content: Horses and riding are two extremely popular forms of{Recreation}in the area,and the Forge at the bottom of Ramsey hill was first built over 300 years ago to cater for this trade.Now however most of their work is connected with the trailers and lorries from the port. Cathy Smiths stable has 35 acres,and is used to graze 7 horses.While there is a small stud farm,called{Stage {Coach stud} Situated at the ancient junction of the road to London{Bridge Foot Farm {Stables}is well placed to receive horses which have been,or are due to be transported to the continent by sea.The horses are regularly inspected,and many famous show jumpers rst their mounts here.Over 2000 a year pass through,the owners living in a grade II listed building c1500.
